doc.after: Native languages of Oceania fall into three major geographic groups  Contact between Austronesian and Papuan resulted in several instances in mixed languages such as Maisin  Colonial languages include English in Australia New Zealand Hawaii and many other territories French in New Caledonia and French Polynesia Japanese in the Bonin Islands Spanish on Easter Island
